metadata.dc:author: Martínez Martínez, M C
Parra Cid, T
metadata.dc:description: The "breath test" based on the measurement of gases in expired air are an alternative to the study of metabolic and functional alterations in gastroenterology. They are classified into two groups based on the molecule analyzed and if the substrate is isotopically labelled or not: H2 and/or CH4 test (malabsorption of sugars, bacterial overgrowth, etc.) and 13CO2 test (infection by H. pylori, exocrine pancreatic function, etc.).
metadata.dc:title: Aplicabilidad de las "pruebas de aliento" al diagnóstico de patología digestiva.
[Utility of "breath test" in diagnosis of digestive diseases].
